alert.note: Alert for Brown; Geary; Jackson; Morris; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 10:21PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Geary, southeastern Riley, Morris, northwestern Wabaunsee, Pottawatomie, Nemaha, northwestern Jackson and western Brown Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1020 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Baileyville to 4 miles west of Woodbine. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Wamego, Hiawatha, Sabetha, Herington, Seneca, Alma, Westmoreland, Blaine, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Onaga, St. George, White City, Centralia, Alta Vista, Wetmore, Dwight, Fairview and McFarland. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 299 and 331. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Geary; Jackson; Morris; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee
